abstract: Many former Google employees, now entrepreneurs, have tapped into a network of affluent and technically skilled investors — their former co-workers.
snippet: Many former Google employees, now entrepreneurs, have tapped into a network of affluent and technically skilled investors — their former co-workers.
lead_paragraph: AS befits a company whose name is a play on words, Google (named for the mathematical term “googol”) has come up with playful names for its workers. Employees are known as Googlers, new employees are Nooglers and gay employees are Gayglers. Now that the company has been around for a decade and employs upward of 20,000 people, another group has earned its own name: former Googlers are known as Xooglers.

headline.main: Keeping It All in the Google Family
headline.print_headline: Keeping It All In the Google Family

abstract: Microsoft’s upgrade to Windows Live will blend e-mail and social networking to put it ahead of rivals.
snippet: Microsoft’s upgrade to Windows Live will blend e-mail and social networking to put it ahead of rivals.
lead_paragraph: Exactly one year ago, I wrote about the race between Yahoo and Google to turn their e-mail and instant message systems into something closer to social networks. Both companies figured it was futile to take on Facebook and MySpace directly. So they rushed to develop new ways for their users to trade news, photos and so on with the people already in their address books and buddy lists.

headline.main: Microsoft Beats Yahoo and Google to Social Inbox 2.0
